Title#1: Champions of Industry: University of Colorado at Boulder
Abstract#1: An informational video titled "Champions of Industry" by the University of Colorado at Boulder to showcase life and academics at the university through the perspectives (testimonials) of professors, administration, and students.
Note#1: 00:00:01 Champions. Industry. 00:00:14 Champions of Industry. 00:00:17 Pat Summerall talking about CU Boulder. 00:00:50 Aerial footage of CU Boulder. 00:00:54 Richard L. Byyny Chancellor University of Colorado Boulder. 00:01:05 CU Boulder history. 00:01:17 Byyny and Narrator discusses opportunities for students at CU Boulder. Interspersed are student testimonials. 00:02:12 The narrator discusses teachers: Elaine Hansen Director Colorado Space Grant Consortium, Carl Wieman Nobel Prize Recipient and Professor, Jim White Director Environmental Studies. 00:03:15 Narrator discusses cross disciplinary support at CU Boulder. Testimonials from: Charles Wilkinson Professor of Law, Kendra Kilbride Sophomore Aerospace Engineering. 00:04:25 Narrator discusses CU Boulder and alumni who became astronauts. Testimonials from: Jim White, Jen Micheles Senior Electrical Engineering. 00:04:58 Narrator discusses student life and sports at CU Boulder. 00:05:29 Byyny discusses CU Boulders desire to be the best. 00:05:56 Colorado University of Colorado at Boulder www.colorado.edu. 00:06:00 Pat Summerall concludes the video. 00:06:33 End of recording.

Title#1: CU Commencement and CU History, Spring 2000
Publisher#1: University of Colorado Information Technology Services
Abstract#1: A video recording of the May 2000 University of Colorado Boulder commencement ceremony.
Note#1: 00:00:59 Images and video of CU Boulder's campus and the surrounding Flatirons. The narrator discusses the History of CU Boulder. 00:02:04 The Beginning 1876-1920. 00:05:15 Transformation 1920-1950. 00:09:06 Recognition 1950-1980. 00:11:33 Into The Future 1980-Today. 00:16:32 University of Colorado at Boulder Commencement May 12, 2000. 00:18:03 James F. Williams, Dean of Libraries, begins the commencement ceremony introducing University Reagents, State Representatives, University Chancellors, and University professors present at the event. 00:21:52 John Buechner, President, begins his address and introduces Neil Diamond singing the national anthem. 00:26:58 Richard Byyny, Chancellor of University of Colorado Boulder, begins his address. 00:30:32 George "Pinky" Nelson, Astronaut, begins his address. 00:35:08 Scott Carpenter, Astronaut, begins his address. 00:40:13 Byyny presents the Chancellor's Recognition awards. 00:42:25 James Voss, Astronaut, begins his address. 00:41:39 A CU Boulder Chancellor presents Service Awards, University Medals, and Honorary Degrees. 00:47:05 CU Astronauts: A Journey in Space plays on the monitors. 00:56:27 Byyny celebrates Ellison Onizuka and his family. 00:57:31 CU Boulder administration presents degrees to graduate and undergraduate school graduates. 01:08:55 Byyny celebrates alumni in attendance. 01:10:02 Williams introduces the charge of President Norlan which is read by Buechner. 01:14:14 Williams invites the audience to sing the university song. 01:15:48 Williams ends the commencement ceremony. 01:17:11 Produced at University of Colorado Information Technology Services. Remote Production Facilities Provided by CU Athletics Sports Video Department. Copyright 2000 University of Colorado Board of Regents. 01:17: 19 End of recording.

Abstract#1: A collection of candid clips of women playing a variety of sports. The film includes women, possibly Twins Judy and Jill Isgel, playing tennis; Pat Bisant running track and shot put, and women jump roping. Footage likely gathered to accompany "Sports Streak" news story.
Note#1: 00:00:00 Scene of a woman playing tennis. Scene of a woman walking on a track. An interviewer asks if if men and women should compete [no reponse, scene cuts].
